hi and welcome you listening to the ex

they're not going very well out there
there have been delays and talks between

situation and they can see that there's
a huge disagreement between the

while they're flying around Greece is
not accepting additional austerity

looking at this saying ok we need to be
ready and prepared and they feel that
the economic situation is deteriorating
and what we're seeing is that the Greek
people they're making a run on the banks
now there are capital controls in effect
right now but what we're seeing is that
people are taking out as much as they
possibly can
2.5 billion euros left Greek banks in in
the last 45 days and despite the capital
controls that allow Greeks withdraw a

looks like people are continually taking
their currency they don't trust the
banks because they are afraid
that there are going to be more capital
controls or a ballon and you can see
that a lot of these individuals well
they're getting very nervous and they're
taking the currency and they're placing
their currency in their homes
safes bank lockers anyplace but the
banking system and what we're seeing is
that eighty percent of this amount that
is about thirty six billion euros well
they're kept outside of the bank in
these homes they're very nervous about
the banking system and capital controls
and balance and we can see right now you
can't wait for the last minute to start

what you won't have a chance to get your

thought everything was okay they started
putting money back into the Greek banks
now they're realizing well we have
problems once again because everyone

is what they always say when they get

hurting right now I mean if we look at

on said you know the crisis is over
things are going to be improving from in

something like ten point four percent at

has gone absolutely nowhere it is at 10%
what it dropped point four percent it's
still double digits it really doesn't

down to ten point four ten point three
ten point two so nothing has improved
since 2013 and you wonder why people
want a different leader why they want to
get out of the euro why
they don't want a central bank because
they can see right now that things are
not changing they are getting worse and
most likely this unemployment number
this is the manipulated number because
we know that eurozone many of these

does where those people who are no

they're telling us that initial jobless

now we understand there is a student

that has been put up on the

because what we're seeing right now

they're having a very difficult time

bankruptcy in the United States is
governed under the US Constitution
article 1 section 8 Clause 4 which
authorizes Congress to enact uniform
laws on the subject of bankruptcies
throughout the United States
now they excluded student loans which is
ridiculous because when you look at this
you can see that this is the only loan
that you cannot declare bankruptcy on
you cannot discharge the student loans
in bankruptcy so this is a major problem
the question is why is this
why did they decide to do this well if
we got to go back to the Clinton

then in October 7th 1998 Clinton signed
the higher education amendment which
provided federal federal funding for
education loans at a reduced rate of

specific changes regarding the
collection of student loans that was
like a gift to the banks where they were

because they knew that if they declared

the bankers would lose out so this was a

we're seeing right now is that 65% well
they cannot find a job and they can't

we're seeing retail stores closed retail

it's funny just four or five weeks ago

we've said this

they surveyed about a hundred and

percent of investors believe

markets gold is viewed as the best

protectionism the interest in gold come

something very interesting the Federal

hundred thousand and the borrower must

they're supposed to leave a certain

when this crisis hits just like in

they will not have the funds to hand out

the FDIC doesn't have enough to cover
